channel.title: Clicking button to open url (Client SIDED) + 1 more thing
channel.description:
First, I'd like to state I'm not stupid. I know this is supposed to be server sided. Or you can add a client sided command. My problem is my client/server doesn't support opening webpages by command (server sided that is) If someone could link a tut that'd be cool too I want to make it so when you click an interface it opens a webpage, but client sided
other thing: Is it possible to make my loader a .gif?

item.title: Clicking button to open url (Client SIDED) + 1 more thing
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:18, topic:429508”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=532197.msg3892022#msg3892022 date=1326942394]
@zyle I know …just easier for those who have no idea what they are doing.
[/quote]
I know what I’m doing to a point. What I was trying to achieve is to make a server-sided command, ::allvote, when I type it in it would have everyone’s client open the vote screen, unless they were in combat or in wild.[/quote]

If you want to do hat, i would suggest looking into opeming web pages in java. I think theres a method in javax.swing.JEditorPane that might load a URL.

Read full topic

@zyle I know …just easier for those who have no idea what they are doing.

I know what I’m doing to a point. What I was trying to achieve is to make a server-sided command, ::allvote, when I type it in it would have everyone’s client open the vote screen, unless they were in combat or in wild.

item.title: Clicking button to open url (Client SIDED) + 1 more thing
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I didn’t mean like that. I meant like, the server won’t send the url’s to the client for it to open the browser.
you know the command like this:
if(command.equalsignorecase(“vote”); {
sendMessage(“www.google.com”, 12000);
}

Or what ever.
I’m at school and not thinking about this. I know the sendMessage isn’t the correct thing.

Read full topic
item.source: Clicking button to open url (Client SIDED) + 1 more thing

item.title: Clicking button to open url (Client SIDED) + 1 more thing
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:429508”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=532197.msg3890324#msg3890324 date=1326780092]
So, if I understand correctly, you want to change the default loading bar to a rotating circle?

I’m not quite sure how that deals with URLs…

As for opening links through the browser, I personally wouldn’t implement any system like that. You could be playing a server one day, not knowing that you can’t use commands, and when you go to try one, your browser opens up an unwanted webpage.

You would also have a (slight) problem in determining which internet browser to use (not all computers have Internet Explorer, or Firefox, or Chrome, or Safari, etc)
[/quote]

cough read topic title cough + 1 more thing

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=532197.msg3890322#msg3890322 date=1326779936]

If I understand you correctly…you want to make it so when you click on the image while the webclient i sloading (aka applet/jar) you want it to send you to a certain url?

This is pure assumptions here because my web knowledge is horrible…but there should be a way to make a webpage open up by visiting the page. I am not honestly sure you may want to ask that in the general programming area.

I think I got you confused lol.
I want to change my loading image to the one above.

As for the vote system. I want to make it possible to make it so when you click an image in game it would open a client, like if you were to do ::vote.
[/quote]ah okay I see now

well for the vote thing. There is a guide somewhere on how to make a command that takes somebody to a site for example ::forum would take you to your forums there is a guide for this you would just add that line into the clickingbuttons.

so…

case blah:
thecodehere
break;

real simple

For the loading image R-S had a tut for the loading image

I have that code ::forum added in my client, I don’t know how to make my server use it though since I can’t get my server to even go to a url in the first place.[/quote]

You wouldn’t want to have the URLs open server-side anyways.

Read full topic

well for the vote thing. There is a guide somewhere on how to make a command that takes somebody to a site for example ::forum would take you to your forums there is a guide for this you would just add that line into the clickingbuttons.

so…

case blah:

break;

real simple

For the loading image R-S had a tut for the loading image[/quote]

I have that code ::forum added in my client, I don’t know how to make my server use it though since I can’t get my server to even go to a url in the first place.

item.title: Clicking button to open url (Client SIDED) + 1 more thing
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:9, topic:429508”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=532197.msg3890336#msg3890336 date=1326780902]

So, if I understand correctly, you want to change the default loading bar to a rotating circle?

I’m not quite sure how that deals with URLs…

As for opening links through the browser, I personally wouldn’t implement any system like that. You could be playing a server one day, not knowing that you can’t use commands, and when you go to try one, your browser opens up an unwanted webpage.

You would also have a (slight) problem in determining which internet browser to use (not all computers have Internet Explorer, or Firefox, or Chrome, or Safari, etc)
[/quote]isn’t there a way to have it use your default browser?

There is in java.awt.Desktop[/quote]
this

Create a method to open the browser. Not hard.
And then when you click your interface, call the method.

Read full topic
